Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery kantharos; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of chariot to right (body of charioteer wearing chiton decorated with dots in added red, holding reins and goad; part of chariot and tails of one or two horses); behind the horses, part of large round shield with red rim and dots in added white as the device and part of body of the shield-bearer, seemingly facing left; border of panel to left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Interesting use of depth of field for the shield.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 43, pl. XXI, no. 39)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 356, no. B456)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1241) (phase 3)
